He seems to be organized, energetic and eager to please. (The fact that he has a charming smile and bulging biceps is noticeable, but hardly worth dwelling on.)

Maxine becomes a valuable aid, full of fresh new ideas and tremendous energy. She invests a lot of time on your behalf and makes you look good in front of others. Because of your confidence in hiring her, your Vocational sphere takes a
Were you leaning a bit toward choosing Steven, perhaps?
That was very honest of you. In the long run, Maxine does a superb job. It might have been difficult to concentrate around the office if you had hired Steven.
Your impulse control is generally good, judging by your behavior so far. I'm sure this is one of the reasons.
Judging by your past history of untrustworthiness, I must say I find this difficult to believe! In the long run, Maxine serves you very well, putting in a lot of time and energy on your behalf.
Whatever you say. In the long run, Maxine serves you very well, putting in a lot of time and energy on your behalf. In time you may feel more satisfied about your choice.
Were you leaning a bit toward choosing Steven, perhaps?
That was very honest of you. In the long run, Cynthia serves you very well. You must admit, Steven might have made it a bit more difficult to concentrate.
Your impulse control is generally good, judging by your behavior so far. I'm sure this is one of the reasons.

Your impulse control to date has been kind of unreliable. Perhaps you could have resisted the temptation, perhaps you couldn't. In any event, the judgement that you made here suggests that at least you are making a conscious effort to
monitor your behavior. You should be proud of that.

Cynthia is a good choice, but only for a short time. Eventually, you find her style a bit unnerving. "What is going on in that young woman's head?" you wonder. Unfortunately, you never get a chance to find out. One day Cynthia calls and
mentions she is taking a trip to the other side of the country. She never returns.
Was your decision based on Steven's charming smile and rugged good looks?
Are you claiming that his physical appearance has NOTHING to do with choosing him for the job?
Bah! I can't believe that. The other people seemed at least equally qualified.

I guess, then, that if you are willing to admit that his appearance was a factor in the decision, you may have to concede that in all probability you didn't choose the BEST possible person for the job.
That was very honest of you.

He seemed to be very eager to satisfy you during the interview. Could it be that you had more than work in mind for this person? In a short period of time, you discover him to be warm and friendly, with a fantastic sense of humor and
seemingly endless energy. Sometimes you can't help wondering what would happen if the two of you ever became romantic.
#WAIT FOR AN OPPORTUNITY FOR IT TO COME UP NATURALLY
#DO NOT MAKE THE ADVANCE AT ALL

Steven may be friendly, but he's not THAT friendly. It's not long before your working relationship deteriorates, and you are looking for another secretary. Motto: It is often unwise to mix personal and business relationships.

One night, both of you are working late to get a project finished. You have loosened your clothes to be more comfortable, and Steven has rolled up his sleeves, and opened up the top three buttons of his shirt for the same reason. The
nature of the work and the fatigue have made you both giddy. When the job is finally finished, Steven looks at you and sighs.
#GIVE HIM A QUICK "FRIENDLY" HUG OF APPROVAL
#TELL HIM HE'S DONE A GOOD JOB

It's a very good idea not to mix your business and personal lives, but you probably know this already. The temptation, however, is great. If it weren't, you would never have gotten into this situation to begin with. As long as you are
attracted to Steven, you will have to keep careful tabs on your impulses.
His body is warm and strong. For a moment his face is very close to yours. You feel his body pressing up against yours.
Steven excuses himself and heads home for the evening.
He gives you a long delicious kiss that nearly takes your breath away.
#CONTINUE THIS EPISODE TO ITS UNAVOIDABLE CONCLUSION

Things could get very complicated here. In truth, things are ALREADY complicated. This "almost" affair carries with it some of the same negative consequences as a "real" affair. Steven begins to resent the double messages you seem to be
giving him and eventually leaves his job.
The two of you make love in the office, and now you are faced with some difficult
questions, the first of which are those that have to do with your present commitment.

Steven admits that it would never work out but secretly resents the rejection. His work performance begins to slip, not so much from incompetence, but from resentment. Eventually he decides to find work elsewhere.
It's not long before everyone is gossiping about you and Steven. It is the main topic of office chatter for months.
Eventually it gets back to the love of your life, who becomes insane with rage. For a while you think he might leave you, but he can't help staying around. He's crazy about you!
You should be proud of yourself.
Even though Steven is great-looking, you learn to appreciate him for his work skills and for his personality. For now, it is probably best not to mix your business and social lives.
Are you unsure because you think you might not be able to resist the temptation?
Well, do you think Steven would give in to the temptations of an office romance?

O.K., then you will just have to wait and see how it turns out. It's hard to say for sure whether he was the best business choice. On the positive side, the fact that you were willing to hire a man (provided you didn't do it with lustful
intent) was a sign of flexibility.
